H0.text: The larynx is the organ whose muscles tense, stretching the vocal cords so they vibrate to produce sounds.

H1.text: Throat is the organ in which muscles tense, stretching the cords so they vibrate, producing sounds.

H2.text: Thorax is the organ whose muscles, when tensed, stretch the cords so they vibrate, producing sounds.

H3.text: The diaphragm is the organ whose muscles, when tensed, stretch the cords so they vibrate, producing sounds.

A4.text: The larynx generates sound through the rhythmic opening and closing of the vocal folds.
